key_points: Nearly 10% of the $380 billion in direct stimulus checks may be used to buy bitcoin and stocks, according to a Mizuho Securities survey.
Mizuho Securities surveyed approximately 235 individuals with household incomes of less than $150,000.
Around 200 respondents expect to receive the third round of stimulus payments soon.
Nearly 40% of check recipients may invest a portion of their stimulus checks.
The survey suggests a preference for bitcoin over stocks among those planning to invest.
Bitcoin could see a 2-3% increase in its market value from this investment, per the survey.
Stocks that could benefit include Visa, MasterCard, PayPal, and Square.
Goldman Sachs predicts a sizable portion of the new stimulus money could go into the stock market.
Households are expected to be the largest source of equity demand this year, Goldman Sachs noted.
Approximately 90% of American households are eligible for the $1,400 stimulus checks.
spokespersons: David Kostin (Chief U.S. Equity Strategist, Goldman Sachs)
